	We are looking to hire an experienced Account Clerk that would oversee the financial bookkeeping and financial records of the project and record transactions, payments, expenses, and invoices.


Job Purpose


	The Account Clerk will be responsible for the day-to-day financial transactions, documents, banking, and payments in relation to the project&rsquo;s expenses.


Job Description

	Support the Financial Controller&rsquo;s routine, managing project schedules and general accounting procedures.

Accounts Clerk Job at BlueBrain Services Limited




        
    

        
        BlueBrain Services Limited is a human resources services, capacity building, and development project management consulting firm managed by experienced corporate professionals in human resources management, financial services, project management, business development, capacity building, and knowledge management.

We offer bespoke solutions and recent innovations to our clients in a bid to make them go ahead of their competition.
We aim to become one of the top five financial consulting firms in the country.

Our ambition is to deliver quality support services to private and public sector organizations, especially in specialized areas supporting decision-making from operational results.
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Accounts Clerk

Job Reference: BBR-001052
Job Location: Abeokuta, Ogun
Employment Type: Full-time
Career level: Intermediate

Job Summary


	We are looking to hire an experienced Account Clerk that would oversee the financial bookkeeping and financial records of the project and record transactions, payments, expenses, and invoices.


Job Purpose


	The Account Clerk will be responsible for the day-to-day financial transactions, documents, banking, and payments in relation to the project’s expenses.


Job Description


	Oversee the financial bookkeeping and records of the project and record transactions, payments, expenses, and invoices.
	Compile assets record and reconcile budget and expenses within the project.
	Work closely with the auditor to compile all necessary financial documents regarding the project for auditing.
	Support the Financial Controller’s routine, managing project schedules and general accounting procedures.
	Present the quarterly accounting details and address all disparities that may arise in the account reconciliation, quarterly.
	File, record and update all payment vouchers and receipts in hard and soft copy databases.
	Prepare financial reports for the project manager when requested; otherwise, monthly.
	Conduct an In-depth analysis of financial information relating to the project and relay vital information to the relevant authority.
	Assist with clerical and administrative tasks:
	Daily recording of all financial transactions/expenses on an accounting software (QuickBooks).
	Precision in financial recording.
	Promptness in data entry.
	Time taken to process invoices.
	Precision in reconciling bank statements with financial records.
	Effectiveness in credit control.
	Time taken to prepare financial reports.
	Adherence to accounting standards.


Competencies Required


	Requires a Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college/university in Accounting, Finance, or another relevant field.
	Requires at least two (2) years of financial experience.
	Additional years of relevant experience may be considered instead of certification.
	Requires a strong understanding of accounting principles, control procedures, etc..
	Good report writing skills.
	Knowledge of Agribusiness is a plus.
	Basic IT knowledge and experience (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook.
	Ability to manage competing priorities and pay attention to detail.
	High level of commitment, honesty and enthusiasm.
	Strong analytical and interpretive skills.
	Good verbal, written communication and interpersonal skills.

They are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Site Quality Control Inspector

Job Location: Offshore&nbsp;(FPSO)
Line Manager:&nbsp;QAQC Engineer

Job Summary


	Administration of all Quality Control and inspection activities at Site for Notifications, Projects &amp; Site Modification Requests.


Key Responsibilties


	Interface with Site management Team and Onshore Team for the Quality control / Inspection activities for welding, blasting and painting.
	Ensure only the correct consumable (for welding, blasting and painting) as stipulated by the approved WPS / procedures are in use on site by the welders, blasters and painters.
	Ensure only Qualified artisans (welding, blasters and painters) are deployed for all activities
	Ensure continuous update of the welder&rsquo;s qualifications.
	Verifying conformity of the work to specified Quality Requirements and ensuring that the inspections and controls are carried out and documented in accordance with the Quality Procedure.
	Controls coating and welding parameters and consumables during installation / construction activities,
	Ensure the correct implementation of the approved Inspection Test Plan by Construction team / Contractor.
	Checks the availability and suitability of the filler material, preheating, welding, heat treatment, the bevels, the extent of the repairs made by the various welders and taking any corrective actions
	Carry out visual inspections, Verifies dimensional correctness and Monitors defect removal by Magnetic Permeability Inspection (MPI).
	Ensure proper storage of all consumables (welding and Painting) and manage material traceability
	Collate all (welding and coating) technical queries and report to Onshore QAQC Engineer for Response
	Monitor the site Equipment calibration register to ensure only valid equipment are in use
	Inspect all materials on arrival at site for conformity, Prepare weekly and monthly project progress reports.
	Take part in project meetings, where required prepare presentations, to give status of Inspection works etc.
	Ensure proper close out report of welding and coating works in the form of weld history sheet and coating report to reflect the &lsquo;As Built&rsquo;.
	Prepare and issue weekly and monthly report covering all quality inspection works on site.


Accountabilties

	Ensures Zero Quality Defects on all works and Issue NC Reports in the case of defects / Nonconformities

	Participates in site project meetings.


Professional Qualifications


	Certifications &ndash; AWS CWI or CSWIP 3.1 (Level 2): Welding Inspector; NACE II or BGAS CSWIP Painting
	Professional experience of 5 years of minimum in Petroleum industry.
	Inspector Grade II
	Conversant with the International Standards, Codes and Total General Specifications
	Experience: Verifiable experience in the use of MS Office packages.

Site Quality Control Inspector Job at WTS Energy




        
    

        
        WTS Energy - Our client is a Nigerian company that provides services and builds capacity for the oil and gas industry. Their services include operations and maintenance, commissioning, technical assistance, and engineering, procurement, and construction (EPC) projects. They also offer training programs for personnel to improve their skills in areas like operations, maintenance, and safety.

They are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Site Quality Control Inspector

Job Location: Offshore (FPSO)
Line Manager: QAQC Engineer

Job Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Administration of all Quality Control and inspection activities at Site for Notifications, Projects & Site Modification Requests.


Key Responsibilties


	Interface with Site management Team and Onshore Team for the Quality control / Inspection activities for welding, blasting and painting.
	Ensure only the correct consumable (for welding, blasting and painting) as stipulated by the approved WPS / procedures are in use on site by the welders, blasters and painters.
	Ensure only Qualified artisans (welding, blasters and painters) are deployed for all activities
	Ensure continuous update of the welder’s qualifications.
	Verifying conformity of the work to specified Quality Requirements and ensuring that the inspections and controls are carried out and documented in accordance with the Quality Procedure.
	Controls coating and welding parameters and consumables during installation / construction activities,
	Ensure the correct implementation of the approved Inspection Test Plan by Construction team / Contractor.
	Checks the availability and suitability of the filler material, preheating, welding, heat treatment, the bevels, the extent of the repairs made by the various welders and taking any corrective actions
	Carry out visual inspections, Verifies dimensional correctness and Monitors defect removal by Magnetic Permeability Inspection (MPI).
	Ensure proper storage of all consumables (welding and Painting) and manage material traceability
	Collate all (welding and coating) technical queries and report to Onshore QAQC Engineer for Response
	Monitor the site Equipment calibration register to ensure only valid equipment are in use
	Inspect all materials on arrival at site for conformity, Prepare weekly and monthly project progress reports.
	Take part in project meetings, where required prepare presentations, to give status of Inspection works etc.
	Ensure proper close out report of welding and coating works in the form of weld history sheet and coating report to reflect the ‘As Built’.
	Prepare and issue weekly and monthly report covering all quality inspection works on site.


Accountabilties


	Compliance with company’s HSE KPI & Objective and assist company in compliance with overall Client HSE requirement
	Ensures Zero Quality Defects on all works and Issue NC Reports in the case of defects / Nonconformities
	Responsible for all Quality aspect of Material Inspection, Welding, Blasting and Painting Works on Site
	Prepares accurate reports for all site Quality activity
	Participates in site project meetings.


Professional Qualifications


	Certifications – AWS CWI or CSWIP 3.1 (Level 2): Welding Inspector; NACE II or BGAS CSWIP Painting
	Professional experience of 5 years of minimum in Petroleum industry.
	Inspector Grade II
	Conversant with the International Standards, Codes and Total General Specifications
	Experience: Verifiable experience in the use of MS Office packages.
